alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:26AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following creeks in Pennsylvania... Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg affecting Huntingdon County. Yellow Breeches Creek near Camp Hill affecting York and Cumberland Counties. Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern affecting Schuylkill and Lebanon Counties. Swatara Creek near Hershey affecting Lebanon and Dauphin Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following creeks in Pennsylvania... Sherman Creek at Shermans Dale affecting Perry County. For the Aughwick Creek...including Shirleysburg...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sherman Creek...including Shermans Dale...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Yellow Breeches Creek...including Camp Hill...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Swatara Creek...including Harper Tavern, Hershey...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg exceeds its banks. Several homes are affected. At 12.0 feet, Flood waters from Aughwick Creek cover portions of Gilbo Road, Aughwick Mills Road and Keystone Road in Shirley Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The creek is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 10.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
